page.title: 11 CUDHAM - THE VILLAGE
page.content: Cudham is situated on the North Downs and was once called Coedham or Coldham meaning a cold village. The parish covers an area of 5,925 acres and has a population of 4,620 (1961). Most of the housing is spread along Cudham Lane and consists of large and small houses and bungalows with a few terraced cottages. Some of the flint cottages are over 300 years old and the church,also flint ,is nearly 1,000 years of age. The village is peaceful, surrounded by lovely countryside with plenty of quiet footpaths. Several amenities exist in the village including a public house, Post Office/Store, recreation ground, and garage. The village has a parish hall used by the various organisations and clubs such as Youth Club, Residents Association, Womens Institute, and the Village Club. A popular village housing is very expensive.
